title: About
text: The Finance and Artificial intelligence research laB (hereafter FAB) is a cross-disciplinary research project within the finance group of Queen’s Management School. The lab will be industry-focused and aims to provide thought leadership for Northern Ireland’s vibrant financial technology ecosystem.1

title: About
text:
Mission
The mission is to bridge gaps between information technologies, data science, innovation, and financial decision-making. Our goal is to be a global lab of excellence, uniquely located at the gateway between the UK, and the EU. To achieve this mission the lab has the following strategic goals:

Using digital technology to drive innovation for the local fintech community.
Produce internationally acclaimed research in finance, technology and AI.
Produce internationally acclaimed at the intersection of AI-safety, risk management and financial regulation.
Strengthen and develop links with the School of Electronics, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science.2
Foster national and international partnerships with other research labs in financial technology and AI.
Nuclei local fintech companies to inform disruptive research in technology adoption in finance.

title: Rationale
text:

All four drivers have strong links to research areas of AI-safety (in computer science) and risk management (in finance), and financial regulators across the world are grappling with “rules on the books” to provide robust guide rails for this viral-like growth of the digital economy.
